revised_title: Solute Effects on the Fracture Behavior of Armco Iron
tldr: This study investigates the influence of solute additions, such as cobalt, molybdenum, nickel, and silicon, on the deformation and fracture behavior of Armco iron. The J-integral method was used to measure the ductile initiation fracture toughness (JIC) of the alloys. Cobalt significantly enhanced JIC, while molybdenum, nickel, and silicon had a negative effect. The results are explained by changes in the fracture mode, stress concentration, and sulfur segregation at grain boundaries.
